intro: Lexipyretum tenellum, commonly known as the lesser candleplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which appear in late spring to early summer, are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lexipyretum tenellum is a low-growing perennial that is well adapted to withstand drought conditions.
